title: High Energy Intensity Level
description: In 2021, Trinidad and Tobago had an energy intensity level of 18.72 MJ/$2017 PPP GDP, indicating a high energy consumption relative to its economic output.

title: Low GDP per Unit of Energy Use
description: In 2022, the GDP per unit of energy use was only 3.04 PPP $ per kg of oil equivalent, suggesting inefficiencies in energy utilization for economic production.

title: High Energy Use per GDP
description: Trinidad and Tobago used 352.40 kg of oil equivalent per $1,000 GDP in 2022, reflecting a high energy consumption rate compared to economic output.

title: Full Binding Coverage on All Products
description: In 2022, Trinidad and Tobago achieved 100% binding coverage on all products, ensuring comprehensive trade commitments under WTO agreements.

title: Complete Binding Coverage on Primary Products
description: The country maintained a 100% binding coverage on primary products in 2022, securing its trade policies and commitments in the global market.
